column1: The first case of person-to-person transmission of the new coronavirus in the US: The spouse of a Chicago-area woman who had contracted the virus when she traveled to Wuhan, China, the epicenter of the outbreak.

The first case of person-to-person transmission of the new coronavirus in the US: The spouse of a Chicago-area woman who had contracted the virus when she traveled to Wuhan, China, the epicenter of the outbreak.  https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/us-reports-first-person-to-person-transmission-of-new-coronavirus/2020/01/30/63a7832c-4393-11ea-b503-2b077c436617_story.html …

Extraordinary measures being taken to try to contain the coronavirus in China: All travel will be suspended out of Wuhan, a city of 11 million people, two hours from now. As many as a million train passengers and 800 flights go through Wuhan a day https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/nine-dead-as-chinese-coronavirus-spreads-despite-efforts-to-contain-it/2020/01/22/1eaade72-3c6d-11ea-afe2-090eb37b60b1_story.html …

“He who holds the firewood for the masses, is the one who freezes to death in wind and snow.”

That's the phrase being repeated over and over as Chinese citizens mourn the death of Dr Li Wenliang from coronavirus. Story from @gerryshih :https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/chinese-doctor-who-tried-to-raise-alarm-on-coronavirus-in-wuhan-dies-from-disease/2020/02/06/8bf305a2-48f9-11ea-8a1f-de1597be6cbc_story.html …

I absolutely LOVE this concept from @NowChronicles: great writers produce fiction based on a single resonant news story.

I just read "The Sick Month: When the Coronavirus Comes Home," by Benjamin Percy (with a link to the original @nytimes story)

https://chroniclesnow.com/stories/the-sick-month …pic.twitter.com/IsMkiy9NXs
